channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for ND
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for ND

item.title: Report E-2023050403
item.description:
Report E-2023050403

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-05
  • City: WEST FARGO
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Associate punctured freight with forklift blades while loading / unloading causing product to leak

item.title: Report X-2023050220
item.description:
Report X-2023050220

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-21T09:08:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-01
  • City: FARGO
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by incompatible conveyance items getting ready to be placed on main conveyor belt. Exterior packaging was found to be wet and starting to fray. Package was brought to the Quality Assurance area for inspection. Upon inspection, no inner packaging materials used to buffer the 4 plastic jugs of Isopropanol. The jugs had loose caps, causing the product to leak and soil the labels on the jugs. DescribePack: The four jugs of Isopropanol leaked due to loose caps, causing the box to become wet and fray along the edges of the exterior packaging. The labels on the individual bottles of Isopropanol became soiled by leaked product. DurationRel: 36 and MitigateEffect: When package was found, gloves were used for PPE to protect from corrosive materials. Package was likely sitting in a trailer over the weekend, thus unable to be tended to sooner. Tracking system shows package had been in St Paul station 4/29/23, then the trailer with the package was unloaded at Fargo station 5/1/23.

item.title: Report X-2023050193
item.description:
Report X-2023050193

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-21T09:08:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-28
  • City: FARGO
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to the belt to inspect a leaking hazmat package. Package was discovered to have a loose cap with a slow leakage. Jug was investigated and no cracks or holes were found. Cap was found to be loose. Cap was then retightened. Package was put in a blue hazmat bag and then put in a red tote to be brought to QA for processing. DescribePack: The smaller cap on the backside of the jug was found to be loose and was the source of the leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Jug was kept upright and cap was retightened. There were no dents or cracks or other areas of damage besides the loose cap.

item.title: Report X-2023010803
item.description:
Report X-2023010803

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-19T21:08:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-12
  • City: FARGO
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler notified QA that there was a leaking hazmat on a trailer. QA retrieved the damaged hazmat and assessed the package. QA found there was a loose cap and that hazardous solution leaked out of package making the box damp. No amount of hazardous material leaked onto trailer or floor, and no PPE cleaning materials were used besides gloves for handling. The ethanol solution was contained in four one-gallon plastic jugs. Outer packaging was a cardboard box. There was no inner packing material. Package was found at 7:30 AM on 1/12/23. DescribePack: Cap came loose on jug and a small amount of liquid leaked and made packaging wet. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in a red tote lined with blue bag.

item.title: Report X-2022121045
item.description:
Report X-2022121045

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-19T21:08:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-22
  • City: FARGO
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Heavy snow storm caused trailers to be late for unloading. This lead to trailers being exposed to sub-zero Farenheit temperatures longer than usual for shipment of packages. In turn, this lead to the package freezing and cracking, ultimately spilling a small amount of the paint from the crack at the bottom of the drum. Cleaned up in-house with rubber gloves, paper towels, and HAZMAT approved blue bag to contain all HAZMAT and PPE after clean up. DescribePack: The bottom of the drum is bulging outward and cracked. Could not determine exact size of crack due to red pain seeping through crack. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The drum was placed in a HAZMAT approved blue bag, and further placed in a yellow, Damage HAZMAT transfer drum.

Report E-2023030728

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-19T21:08:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-12
  • City: WATFORD CITY
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARATHON PETROLEUM COMPANY LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When the driver was loading, he pulled the cap off of the production companies hose the residual oil, and pressure in the hose sprayed oil out of the hose onto the ground. The hose had no ventilation relief valving on the cap. 1 gallon of spray went to the ground, and a small amount went onto the drivers coveralls.

item.title: Report E-2023030726
item.description:
Report E-2023030726

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-19T21:08:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-14
  • City: KILLDEER
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARATHON PETROLEUM COMPANY LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver shut down the pump operations while loading to wait for maintenance to arrive at the location and repair the truck. While waiting, the truck's power was turned off rendering the Coriolis meter powerless. Because the two truck compartments did not have power, both compartments were open which caused the oil to equalize in the two compartments. After the truck was repaired, the driver restarted the loading process. The driver did not realize that there was already 36 bbls. of oil in the rear compartment. After loading, the total was 6 bbl. short of an overfill, but because it was so close to the maximum fill, there was a surge resulting in 5 gallons leaking out of the trailer vent line onto the ground.

item.title: Report E-2022100082
item.description:
Report E-2022100082

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-19T21:08:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-16
  • City: BISMARCK
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0711 ET, terminal XBW reported a spill that occurred inside trailer #3150335 in Bismark, ND. At the time of the call, XPO personnel were unsure what released. ERTS dispatched Baranko Bros, Inc. to investigate and conduct cleanup. At 1230 ET, the contractor arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 gallons of UN1992 Corr12525B from a 275 gallon poly tote. Crews transferred the material from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and collected. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all waste into (2) 55 gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2022081530
item.description:
Report X-2022081530

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-19T21:08:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-08
  • City: FARGO
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was moving along conveyer belt when package handler noticed leaking product. Package was brought to QA staging area. Product was slow to spill out of shipping container and almost unnoticed by QA team. Upon further inspection, discovered that the plastic pail inside the box was cracked and spilling product. DescribePack: Exterior cardboard packaging had product slowly spill out the seams of the box. Plastic pail had a 5 inch long crack near the bottom of the pail, curving up and to the left from the bottom of the pail. Product was spilling from this crack into the cardboard shipping container. A large pile of product was surrounding the plastic pail in the bottom of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged product placed in a blue bag, which in turn was placed in a locking yellow bin for sending to proper disposal location. Any spilled product was carefully swept into the the bag as well.

item.title: Report E-2023030718
item.description:
Report E-2023030718

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-19T21:08:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-17
  • City: KILLDEER
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARATHON PETROLEUM COMPANY LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: After driver finished loading oil, he went to engage the cleanout mode. When he returned to the Getty Box he realized that the locking ears on the load hose fitting had failed causing the hose to pop off of the load line. The oil started to fill the Getty Box spilling over into the containment area on the ground.

item.title: Report E-2023030717
item.description:
Report E-2023030717

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-19T21:08:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-14
  • City: ALEXANDER
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARATHON PETROLEUM COMPANY LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was traveling while he noticed something spraying outward from the body mounted tank. After further inspection realized there was a gasket that failed on the tank side of the fire valve. The driver could not control the spill. The gasket had became too old and brittle to function correctly and was not replaced before it failed.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: Driver was hand gauging the tanks when their instrument broke. The driver went down and unhook the load hose from the load line at the tank battery. As the hose was disconnected a spray of 1/2 gallon of oil came out of the load pipe because the main valve was not closed.

item.title: Report X-2022080919
item.description:
Report X-2022080919

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-19T21:08:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-14
  • City: PALERMO
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2022080919: Z-CHCPTL3 13A train derailed near Palermo, ND on 07/14/2022. The derailment involved lines 23-32 with container FDXU 531152 being involved in the derailment. Container FDXU 531152 contained 6 totes of Alcohols. The derailment caused two totes of Alcohols to release due to being crushed. BNSF contractor repacked the material to prevent further release. 2. X-2022080927: Z-CHCPTL3 13A train derailed near Palermo, ND on 7/14/2022. The derailment involved lines 23-32 with container RNLU 100590 being involved in the derailment. RNLU 100590 contained 23 pails of Hypochlorite Solutions. The derailment caused one 5 gallon pail of Hypochlorite Solution to be released due to being crushed. BNSF contractor repacked the material to prevent further release. 3. X-2022080928: Z-CHCPTL3 13A train derailed near Palermo, ND on 7/14/2022. The derailment involved lines 23-32 with container RNLU 100590 being involved in the derailment. RNLU 100590 contained 5 pails of Isopropanol. The derailment caused one 5 gallon pail of Isopropanol to be released due to being crushed. BNSF contractor repacked the material to prevent further release. 4. X-2022080933: Z-CHCPTL3 13A train derailed near Palermo, ND on 7/14/2022. The derailment involved lines 23-32 with container RNLU 100590 being involved in the derailment. RNLU 100590 contained 15 boxes containing two 1 gallon bottles of sodium hydroxide in each box. The derailment caused one box to be crushed and released two one gallon jugs of sodium hydroxide. BNSF contractor repacked the material to prevent further release.

item.title: Report E-2022070297
item.description:
Report E-2022070297

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-19T21:08:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-30
  • City: WILLISTON
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ACME TRUCK LINE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 30, 2022, a vehicle operated by Acme Truck Line, Inc. (ATL) experienced a rollover following a single-vehicle accident. As a result, approximately twenty (20) gallons of KI-38021 released from overturned cargo to the soil surface. ATL retained Cura Emergency Services, LC (CES) to manage the environmental remediation of the site. CES dispatched a crew from Baranko Brothers Inc. (BBI) to perform the necessary corrective action. BBI personnel performed excavation operations until no visual or olfactory evidence of free product remained in the soil. All totes were returned to the warehouse. Following the excavation, BBI performed backfill and site restoration operations via clean soil and grass seed to return the area to prerelease conditions.
